comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Low quality image of a US Navy supersonic photo reconnaissance jet flying high and slow with tailhook down and wing flaps & slats engaged. Ling Temco Vought RF-8A Crusader 146899 is recorded with VFP-63 Detachment D, squadron code PP and Modex 920 when part of Carrier Air Wing Fifteen (CVW-15) aboard CVA-43 USS Coral Sea during a very long and arduous deployment in support of the Vietnam War from December 7 1964 to November 1 1965. www.gonavy.jp/index.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NLf.html (‘GO!NAVY’ info thanks to Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) These missions were extremely hazardous as pre-strike recon images were gathered while the defenses did not know the RF-8 was coming, but knew they would be back for post-strike pictures and were eagerly waiting to shoot them out of the sky. RF-8A Crusader 146899 was upgraded by LTV to RF-8G during 1965-1966: www.joebaugher.com/navy_fighters/f8_10.html (info courtesy of Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago Illinois) RF-8G Crusader 146899 was shot down by Anti-Aircraft Artillery over North Vietnam on October 8, 1966, while with VFP-63 Detachment A (squadron code PP and Modex 896) as part of Carrier Air Wing Two (CVW-2) aboard CVA-43 USS Coral Sea again deployed to the Gulf of Tonkin for the Vietnam War. Pilot Lieutenant (junior grade) F. D. Litvin ejected and was fortunately rescued. www.ejection-history.org.uk/Aircraft_by_Type/F_8_Crusader... (info courtesy of www.ejection-history.org.uk) This was during the USS Coral Sea deployment to the West Pacific and South China Sea between 29 July 1966 & 23 February 1967 www.gonavy.jp/index.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NEf.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW2-NE1966.html (‘GO!NAVY’ info courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan & naval aviation historian)
